summary: The Gunnison Outdoor Resources Protection Act of 2025 designates various special management areas, wildlife conservation areas, protection areas, recreation management areas, wilderness areas, and a scientific research and education area in Gunnison County, Colorado. It outlines specific management practices for each area, including restrictions on vehicle use, provisions for winter travel management, and guidelines for vegetation management. The bill also addresses land to be held in trust for the Ute Mountain Ute Tribe, and modifies the boundaries of existing wilderness areas..
